results.title: High cholesterol triggers white matter alterations and cognitive deficits in a mouse model of cerebrovascular disease: benefits of simvastatin
results.text_hl: High @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ triggers @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@white matter alterations@@@ and @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive deficits@@@ in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular disease@@@: benefits of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates hypomyelination induced by hypoxia-ischemia in neonatal rats.
results.text_hl: Therefore, we investigated whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could promote the myelination of @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@oligodendrocytes@@@ in the neonatal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ after HI and explored the possible role of microglial responses in this process.

citations.NLM: Li A, Lv S, Yu Z, Zhang Y, Ma H, Zhao H, Piao H, Li S, Zhang N, Sun C. Simvastatin attenuates hypomyelination induced by hypoxia-ischemia in neonatal rats. Neurol Res. 2010 Nov;32(9):945-52. PMID: 20433776

results.title: Effects of statins on the progression of cerebral white matter lesion: Post hoc analysis of the ROCAS (Regression of Cerebral Artery Stenosis) study.
results.text_hl: Linear multivariate regression analysis identified that baseline @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@WML@@@ volume (beta = 0.63, P < 0.001) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment (beta = -0.214, P = 0.043) independently predicted change in @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@WML@@@ volume.

citations.NLM: Mok VC, Lam WW, Fan YH, Wong A, Ng PW, Tsoi TH, Yeung V, Wong KS. Effects of statins on the progression of cerebral white matter lesion: Post hoc analysis of the ROCAS (Regression of Cerebral Artery Stenosis) study. J Neurol. 2009 May;256(5):750-7. PMID: 19252811
